title: NISSANKA SENADHIPATHI TO BE PRODUCED BEFORE COURTS ON 14TH
body:
Sri Lanka, Oct. 22 -- The Colombo High Court today ordered prisons officials to produce Nissanka Senadhipathi 
who is in remand custody before the court on the 14th of this month.

The case against the former Chairman of the Rakna Lanka Security Company, Major General Palitha Fernando and 
the Chairman of Avant-Garde Nissanka Senadhipathi for soliciting and offering a bribe of 35.5 million was taken up 
before Colombo High Court Judge Shashi Mahendran today.

Our court correspondent stated that Nissanka Senadhipathi who is the second accused in the case did not appear 
in court. Attorney-at-Law Gamini Marapana, appearing on behalf of him, informed the court that his client had 
been remanded for another case. Therefore, the case will be taken up again on the 14th of this month and the 
judge informed that the trial dates would be set on that date. The Magistrate also ordered the Superintendent of 
Prisons to take steps to produce Nissanka Senadhipathi in Court on that day.
